captions.text:
Whass crackin B? Welcome back to
Thug Notes. This week we keepin it classy with
Pride and Prejudice by Jane Austen.

This book tell the story of
Elisabeth Bennett and her fine sistas. Now

Mama Bennett be trying to get them girls to
strut they stuff in order to find some husbands.

One day, two hood rich cats named
Bingley and Darcy roll in to town. Mama Bennet

be geeked up trying to sling Jane in front
of that boy Bingley. Look, I ain’t saying

she a gold digger, but Bingley sure as hell
ain’t no broke ni**a.

So Jane gets all dolled up and
tears it up with Bingley up in the club. Same

night, Liz try to kick it with Darcy, but
that honky straight disses her saying she

ain’t fly enough to roll with his crew.
Liz just ain’t having it with this fool.

Shortly after, a rich preacher man
named Collins and a smooth talkin soldier

boy named Wickham drop in to holler at dem
Bennett girls. Wickham tells Lizzie that he

got beef with that fool Darcy over some cash
Darcy be owing him. Couple days later, Jane

be straight trippin cuz Bingley peaced out
of town with no explanation

Then one day Lizzie runs in to that punk Darcy
and discovers he was the one who went up to

Bingham and said
“Yo shawty, don’t marry that trick Jane.

” Oh snap! Then Darcy dun confess his love
to Liz but my girl be all like “Hell naw
blood, you cock blocked my sister.”

Then Darcy sends Liz a letter sayin
that his beef with Wickham is cuz dat playa

tried to marry his sister in order to get
some o dat old money. Not only that, but he

only told Bingley to drop Jane cuz he thought
she wasn’t feeling it.

Later, Lizzy finds out that her
baby sister Lydia been seduced by Wickham

and run away with that playa. Now that Wickham
dun jacked up Lydia reputation, he gonna marry

her only if the Bennets pay him to do it.
Dayum!

So homeboy Darcy straight up comes
to the rescue and pays Wickham to marry Lydia.

After Liz finds out that it was Darcy dat
saved her sister from dirty skank status,
Lizzie straight falls for this honkie.
Good thing for her that Bingley soon realizes that Jane reallyis the foxiest hoe in the hood. So Bingley

brings his ace Darcy to the Bennets place,
admits he’s been actin a fool, and marries

Jane. Den my man Darcy proposes to Liz and
they get married. Happy ending for all dem
white girls!

All the baddest cats in the hood know dat
the opening sentence of

this book is one of the most important in
all of literature.

Sparky reads the line: “It is a truth universally
acknowledged, that a single man in possession
of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife.”

Now you might be thinkin: Is this
real talk right here or is Jane Austen just

playin when she throw out big-ass terms like
“universal truth”? This exactly the kind

of irony Austen be slinging all up in this
bitch.

For example, on one hand, Liz
shackin up with that rich play boy Darcy supports
all dem hierarchical anti-feminist traditions.
But on the other hand, my girl

Liz ain’t acting like society’s bitch.
Naw, she says fuck the establishment and be

actin strong willed, independent, and don’t
take no lip from that boy Darcy. Now that’s
some kind of woman!

So the truf is: my girl Jane Austen
don’t play it straight. She be slingin irony

all day erry day makin this book liable for
all kinds of opposing interpretations.

Yo peep these themes, blood- moral
blindness and self knowledge. Early on, Darcy’s

pride make him think that Lizzy would geek
out at the chance to marry him cuz he got

swoel pockets and she ain’t nothin but a
hood rat.

Also, Lizzy’s prejudice make her
jump to some whack-ass conclusions after Wickham

tells her about his beef with Darcy. But after
Liz rejects Darcy and he sends her the letter

explaining how things really be, these fools
realize how their pride and prejudice be clouding
their moral judgement home boy.

Yo if you wanna talk central theme
up in here, listen good. Traditional society

be full of egos, class structures, social
laws, economics- All which all be puttin distance

between people. So what Austen may be askin
is: How the fuck are people gonna come together
in a world of such distances playa?

Hey thanks for watching Thug Notes.
Make sure yo' ass subscribe and see you next week playa!

form of Elizabeth was before her time. A woman who spoke her mind and 
wouldn't accept a man just because it was what was expected of her. But 
when said man shows his true colors AND happens to be independently 
wealthy, she may be a feminist deep down, but she's also a sucker for true 
love and not stupid enough to throw away a perfectly good man just because 
he's rich. Loved this! :)
